metadata.title: CVE-2020-4788 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
IBM Power9 (AIX 7.1, 7.2, and VIOS 3.1) processors could allow a local userto obtain sensitive information from the data in the L1 cache underextenuating circumstances. IBM X-Force ID: 189296.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-4788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-lowlatency - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-197-lowlatency - 4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1082-aws - 4.4.0-1082.86
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1100-azure - 4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1082.86').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1').
